If you casting or copying an instant or sorcery spell causes a triggered ability of a permanent you control to trigger, that ability triggers an additional time.

cards.text: Magecraft - Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, scry 1. If that spell's mana value is 5 or greater, create a 4/4 blue and red Elemental creature token. If that spell's mana value is 10 or greater, Zaffai, Thunder Conductor deals 10 damage to an opponent chosen at random.

cards.name: Gyome, Master Chef

Trample

{1}, Sacrifice a Food: Target creature gains indestructible until end of turn. Tap it.

cards.text: {1}, {T}: Choose another target creature. Put a number of +1/+1 counters on it equal to the amount of life you gained this turn or the amount of life you lost this turn, whichever is greater. Activate only as a sorcery.

cards.name: Alibou, Ancient Witness
cards.text:
Other artifact creatures you control have haste.
Whenever one or more artifact creatures you control attack, Alibou, Ancient Witness deals X damage to any target and you scry X, where X is the number of tapped artifacts you control.

cards.text:

{1}, Sacrifice an artifact: Target creature you control gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
{X}, {T}, Exile an artifact with mana value X from your graveyard: Create two tokens that are copies of the exiled card. Activate only as a sorcery.

If one or more tokens would be created under your control, twice that many of those tokens are created instead.

cards.text:
Flying
The first time you would create one or more tokens during each of your turns, you may instead choose a creature other than Esix, Fractal Bloom and create that many tokens that are copies of that creature.

Flying

Whenever a land enters the battlefield under an opponent's control, if that player controls more lands than you, you may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Bronze Guardian
cards.text:
Double strike
Ward {2} (Whenever this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter it unless that player pays {2}.)
Other artifacts you control have ward {2}.
Bronze Guardian's power is equal to the number of artifacts you control.

cards.name: Combat Calligrapher
cards.text:
Flyinh
Inklings can't attack you or planeswalkers you control.
Whenever a player attacks one of your opponents, that attacking player creates a tapped 2/1 white and black Inkling creature token with flying that's attacking that opponent.

cards.name: Digsite Engineer
cards.text: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may pay {2}. If you do, create a 0/0 colorless Construct artifact creature token with "This creature gets +1/+1 for each artifact you control."
cards.flavor: "Dig over there, you bolthead!"

cards.name: Excavation Technique
cards.text:
Demonstrate (When you cast this spell, you may copy it. If you do, choose an opponent to also copy it. Players may choose new targets for their copies.)
Destroy target nonland permanent. Its controller creates two Treasure tokens.
cards.flavor: "Stand back. This part gets messy."

cards.name: Guardian Archon
cards.text:
Flying
As Guardian Archon enters the battlefield, secretly choose an opponent.
Reveal the player you chose: You and target permanent you control each gain protection from the chosen player until end of turn. Activate only once.

cards.name: Losheel, Clockwork Scholar
cards.text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to attacking artifact creatures you control.
Whenever one or more artifact creatures enter the battlefield under your control, draw a card. This ability triggers only once each turn.

cards.name: Monologue Tax
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts their second spell each turn, you create a Treasure token.
cards.flavor:
"Your unsolicited words enrich us all. Please, continue."
-Yold, professor of cryptorelicology

cards.name: Nils, Discipline Enforcer
cards.text:
At the beginning of your end step, for each player, put a +1/+1 counter on up to one target creature that player controls.
Each creature with one or more counters on it can't attack you or planeswalkers you control unless its controller pays {X}, where X is the number of counters on that creature.

cards.name: Promise of Loyalty
cards.text: Each player puts a vow counter on a creature they control and sacrifices the rest. Each of those creatures can't attack you for as long as it has a vow counter on it.
cards.flavor: "It's us against the world. Forever."

cards.name: Scholarship Sponsor
cards.text: When Scholarship Sponsor enters the battlefield, each player who controls fewer lands than the player who controls the most lands searches their library for a number of basic land cards less than or equal to the difference, puts those cards onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffles.

cards.name: Commander's Insight
cards.text: Target player draws X cards plus an additional card for each time they've cast a commander from the command zone this game.
cards.flavor: No amount of solitary studying can replace a master's tutelage.

cards.name: Curiosity Crafter
cards.text:
Flying
You have no maximum hand size.
Whenever a creature token you control deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.

cards.name: Dazzling Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Dazzling Sphinx deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles cards from the top of their library until they exile an instant or sorcery card. You may cast that card without paying its mana cost. Then that player puts the exiled cards that weren't cast this way on the bottom of their library in a random order.

cards.name: Deekah, Fractal Theorist
cards.text:
Magecraft - Whenever you cast or copy an instant or sorcery spell, create a 0/0 green and blue Fractal creature token. Put X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is that spell's mana value.
{3}{U}: Target creature token can't be blocked this turn.

cards.name: Inspiring Refrain
cards.text:
Draw two cards. Exile Inspiring Refrain with three time counters on it.
Suspend 3-{2}{U} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, pay {2}{U} and exile it with four time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Muse Vortex
cards.text: Exile the top X cards of your library. You may cast an instant or sorcery spell with mana value X or less from among them without paying its mana cost. Then put the exiled instant or sorcery cards that weren't cast this way into your hand the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

cards.name: Octavia, Living Thesis
cards.text:
This spell costs {8} less to cast if you have eight or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard.
Ward {8}
Magecraft - Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, target creature has base power and toughness 8/8 until end of turn.

cards.name: Perplexing Test
cards.text:
Choose one -
• Return all creature tokens to their owners' hands.
• Return all nontoken creatures to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: "Your proofs were a bit nontraditional, but effective nonetheless. Full marks."

cards.name: Replication Technique
cards.text:
Demonstrate (When you cast this spell, you may copy it. If you do, choose an opponent to also copy it. Players may choose new targets for their copies.)
Create a token that's a copy of target permanent you control.

cards.name: Sly Instigator
cards.text: {U}, {T}: Until your next turn, target creature an opponent controls can't be blocked. Goad that creature. (Until your next turn, that creature attacks each combat if able and attacks a player other than you if able.)
cards.flavor: "Me? I'm just an innocent bystander!"

cards.name: Spawning Kraken
cards.text: Whenever a Kraken, Leviathan, Octopus, or Serpent you control deals combat damage to a player, create a 9/9 blue Kraken creature token.
cards.flavor:
"I never imagined I'd lay eyes on a creature that makes Gyruda look small and harmless!"
-Lukka

cards.name: Theoretical Duplication
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature enters the battlefield under an opponent's control this turn, create a token that's a copy of that creature.
cards.flavor:
"You made it asymmetrical just to annoy me, didn't you?"
-Imbraham, Quandrix dean

cards.name: Author of Shadows
cards.text: When Author of Shadows enters the battlefield, exile all cards from all opponents' graveyards. Choose a nonland card exiled this way. You may cast that card for as long as it remains exiled, and you may spend mana as though it were mana of any color to cast that spell.

cards.name: Blight Mound
cards.text:
Attacking Pests you control get +1/+0 and have menace.
Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, create a 1/1 black and green Pest creature token with "When this creature dies, you gain 1 life."
cards.flavor: Pests feed on carrion, mud, and one another.

cards.name: Bold Plagiarist
cards.text:
Flash
Whenever an opponent puts one or more counters on a creature they control, they put the same number and kind of counters on Bold Plagiarist.
cards.flavor: "I know a good idea when I see one."

cards.name: Cunning Rhetoric
cards.text: Whenever an opponent attacks you and/or one or more planeswalkers you control, exile the top card of that player's library. You may play that card for as long as it remains exiled, and you may spend mana as though it were mana of any color to cast it.

cards.name: Essence Pulse
cards.text: You gain 2 life. Each creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the amount of life you gained this turn.
cards.flavor:
"There is nothing so invigorating and stubbornly belligerent as the pure energy of life."
-Valentin, Witherbloom dean

cards.name: Fain, the Broker
cards.text:
{T}, Sacrifice a creature: Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature.
{T}, Remove a counter from a creature you control: Create a Treasure token.
{T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Create a 2/1 white and black Inkling creature token with flying.
{3}{B}: Untap Fain, the Broker.

cards.name: Incarnation Technique
cards.text:
Demonstrate (When you cast this spell, you may copy it. If you do, choose an opponent to also copy it.)
Mill five cards, then return a creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Draw out your fear, but don't let it control you. You're in charge now."

cards.name: Keen Duelist
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you and target opponent each reveal the top card of your library. You each lose life equal to the mana value of the card revealed by the other player. You each put the card you revealed into your hand.

cards.name: Marshland Bloodcaster
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{B}, {T}: Rather than pay the mana cost of the next spell you cast this turn, you may pay life equal to that spell's mana value.
cards.flavor: Blood magic is more artery than science.

cards.name: Stinging Study
cards.text: You draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is the mana value of a commander you own on the battlefield or in the command zone.
cards.flavor: Silverquill first-years welcome discomfort in the classroom, knowing it will prepare them for the years ahead.

cards.name: Tivash, Gloom Summoner
cards.text:
Lifelink
At the beginning of your end step, if you gained life this turn, you may pay X life, where X is the amount of life you gained this turn. If you do, create an X/X black Demon creature token with flying.

cards.name: Veinwitch Coven
cards.text:
Menace

cards.flavor: Some Strixhaven study groups are more welcoming than others.

cards.name: Audacious Reshapers
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal an artifact card. Put that card onto the battlefield and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order. Audacious Reshapers deals damage to you equal to the number of cards revealed this way.

cards.name: Battlemage's Bracers

Demonstrate (When you cast this spell, you may copy it. If you do, choose an opponent to also copy it.)
Shuffle your library, then reveal cards from the top of it until you reveal a nonland card. Exile that card and put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order. You may cast the exiled card without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Cursed Mirror
cards.text:
{T}: Add {R}.
As Cursed Mirror enters the battlefield, you may have it become a copy of any creature on the battlefield until end of turn, except it has haste.

Trample
Inferno Project enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the total mana value of instant and sorcery cards in your graveyard.

Haste

Whenever you exile one or more cards from your library and/or your graveyard, put a +1/+1 counter on Laelia.

Flash

Copy that spell or ability for each other permanent or player the spell or ability could target. Each copy targets a different one of those permanents and players.

cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, create X tokens that are copies of another target creature you control, where X is one plus the number of instant and sorcery spells you've cast this turn. They gain haste. Exile them at the beginning of the next end step.

Suspend 3-{1}{R} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{R} and exile it with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

Menace

cards.text: Exile target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard. Creatures you control get +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is that card's mana value. Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player this turn, copy the exiled card. You may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Blossoming Bogbeast
cards.text: Whenever Blossoming Bogbeast attacks, you gain 2 life. Then creatures you control gain trample and get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the amount of life you gained this turn.
cards.flavor:
As subtle as a bogbeast
-Witherbloom expression meaning
"crude and clumsy"

cards.name: Ezzaroot Channeler

Reach
Creature spells you cast cost {X} less to cast, where X is the amount of life you gained this turn.
{T}: You gain 2 life.

Equip {2}

cards.text:
Flash
Commander creatures you control get +2/+2.
Commanders you control have hexproof.
cards.flavor: After years of research, he finally unlocked the formula for a perfect punch.

cards.name: Healing Technique
cards.text:
Demonstrate (When you cast this spell, you may copy it. If you do, choose an opponent to also copy it. Players may choose new targets for their copies.)
Return target card from your graveyard to your hand. You gain life equal to that card's mana value. Exile Healing Technique.

cards.text:
Paradox Zone enters the battlefield with a growth counter on it.
At the beginning of your end step, double the number of growth counters on Paradox Zone. Then create a 0/0 blue and green Fractal creature token. Put X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the number of growth counters on Paradox Zone.

cards.name: Pest Infestation
cards.text: Destroy up to X target artifacts and/or enchantments. Create twice X 1/1 black and green Pest creature tokens with "When this creature dies, you gain 1 life."
cards.flavor: A thousand years of history undone by one juvenile prank.

cards.name: Ruxa, Patient Professor
cards.text:
Whenever Ruxa, Patient Professor enters the battlefield or attacks, return target creature card with no abilities from your graveyard to your hand.
Creatures you control with no abilities get +1/+1.
You may have creatures you control with no abilities assign their combat damage as though they weren't blocked.

cards.name: Sequence Engine
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Exile target creature card with mana value X from a graveyard. Create a 0/0 green and blue Fractal creature token. Put X +1/+1 counters on it. Activate only as a sorcery.
cards.flavor:
"Reality, when broken down, is just math."
-Deekah, professor of fractal theory

cards.name: Sproutback Trudge
cards.text:
This spell costs {X} less to cast, where X is the amount of life you gained this turn.
Trample
At the beginning of your end step, if you gained life this turn, you may cast Sproutback Trudge from your graveyard.

cards.name: Trudge Garden
cards.text: Whenever you gain life, you may pay {2}. If you do, create a 4/4 green Fungus Beast creature token with trample.
cards.flavor:
"Sure, trudges smell like soggy death, but the mushrooms on their backs are the tastiest delicacy in Sedgemoor!"
-Gyome, Witherbloom chef

cards.name: Yedora, Grave Gardener
cards.text: Whenever another nontoken creature you control dies, you may return it to the battlefield face down under its owner's control. It's a Forest land. (It has no other types or abilities.)
cards.flavor: "Ever in death, we never stop growing."

cards.name: Inkshield
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to you this turn. For each 1 damage prevented this way, create a 2/1 white and black Inkling creature token with flying.
cards.flavor: Silverquill's elite know how to offer a scathing rebuttal without uttering a word.

cards.name: Oversimplify
cards.text: Exile all creatures. Each player creates a 0/0 green and blue Fractal creature token and puts a number of +1/+1 counters on it equal to the total power of creatures they controlled that were exiled this way.
cards.flavor:
"A fine example of addition by subtraction."
-Deekah, professor of fractal history

cards.name: Reinterpret
cards.text: Counter target spell. You may cast a spell with an equal or lesser mana value from your hand without paying its mana cost.
cards.flavor:
"With just a little added flair, your work could be truly spectacular. Let me show you."
-Nassari, Prismari dean

cards.name: Revival Experiment
cards.text: For each permanent type, return up to one card of that type from your graveyard to the battlefield. You lose 3 life for each card returned this way. Exile Revival Experiment.
cards.flavor: What goes into the vivipods never quite matches what comes out.

cards.name: Wake the Past
cards.text: Return all artifact cards from your graveyard to the battlefield. They gain haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Belong in a museum? I think we should let relics belong wherever they please!"
-Quintorius, Lorehold mage-student

cards.name: Elementalist's Palette
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a spell with {X} in its mana cost, put two charge counters on Elementalist's Palette.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
{T}: Add {C} for each charge counter on Elementalist's Palette. Spend this mana only on costs that contain {X}.

cards.name: Geometric Nexus
cards.text:
Whenever a player casts an instant or sorcery spell, put a number of charge counters on Geometric Nexus equal to that spell's mana value.
{6}, {T}, Remove all charge counters from Geometric Nexus: Create a 0/0 green and blue Fractal creature token. Put X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the number of charge counters removed this way.

cards.name: Tempting Contract
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, each opponent may create a Treasure token. For each opponent who does, you create a Treasure token.
cards.flavor:
"Don't think of it as debt. Think of it as an investment in yourself."
-Diriga, demon bursar

cards.name: Triplicate Titan
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance, trample
When Triplicate Titan dies, create a 3/3 colorless Golem artifact creature token with flying, a 3/3 colorless Golem artifact creature token with vigilance, and a 3/3 colorless Golem artifact creature token with trample.

cards.name: Study Hall
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color. When you spend this mana to cast your commander, scry X, where X is the number of times it's been cast from the command zone this game.

cards.name: Witch's Clinic
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{2}, {T}: Target commander gains lifelink until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Students from other colleges are invited to visit Witherbloom's medical facilities. Not many do.

cards.name: Desolation Twin
cards.text: When you cast this spell, create a 10/10 colorless Eldrazi creature token.
cards.flavor:
"With precise coordination and enough blood spilled, one can be driven off, even brought down. But two . . . that's a lot of blood."
-Munda, ambush leader

cards.name: Angel of Serenity
cards.text:
Flying
When Angel of Serenity enters the battlefield, you may exile up to three other target creatures from the battlefield and/or creature cards from graveyards.
When Angel of Serenity leaves the battlefield, return the exiled cards to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Boreas Charger
cards.text:
Flying
When Boreas Charger leaves the battlefield, choose an opponent who controls more lands than you. Search your library for a number of Plains cards equal to the difference and reveal them. Put one of them onto the battlefield tapped and the rest into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Citadel Siege
cards.text:
As Citadel Siege enters the battlefield, choose Khans or Dragons.
• Khans - At the beginning of combat on your turn, put two +1/+1 counters on target creature you control.
• Dragons - At the beginning of combat on each opponent's turn, tap target creature that player controls.

cards.name: Cleansing Nova
cards.text:
Choose one -
• Destroy all creatures.
• Destroy all artifacts and enchantments.
cards.flavor: In their final moments, the demons gazed upon grace in its purest form.

cards.name: Darksteel Mutation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature is an Insect artifact creature with base power and toughness 0/1 and has indestructible, and it loses all other abilities, card types, and creature types.
cards.flavor: Infinitely powerless.

cards.name: Dispatch
cards.text:
Tap target creature.
Metalcraft - If you control three or more artifacts, exile that creature.
cards.flavor: Venser wondered if it could still be called a teleportation spell if the destination is oblivion.

cards.name: Dispeller's Capsule
cards.text: {2}{W}, {T}, Sacrifice Dispeller's Capsule: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"I find its symmetry pleasing. It rids our world of offensive refuse while disposing of itself."
-Dolomarus, Proctor of the Clean

cards.name: Duelist's Heritage
cards.text: Whenever one or more creatures attack, you may have target attacking creature gain double strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The best techniques outlive their creators.

cards.name: Elite Scaleguard
cards.text:
When Elite Scaleguard enters the battlefield, bolster 2. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put two +1/+1 counters on it.)
Whenever a creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it attacks, tap target creature defending player controls.

cards.name: Ghostly Prison
cards.text: Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature they control that's attacking you.
cards.flavor: Thought the spirits' bodies were ethereal, Agnur soon learned that their blades were quite solid-and razor-sharp.

cards.name: Gideon, Champion of Justice
cards.text:
[+1]: Put a loyalty counter on Gideon, Champion of Justice for each creature target opponent controls.
[0]: Until end of turn, Gideon, Champion of Justice becomes a Human Soldier creature with power and toughness each equal to the number of loyalty counters on him and gains indestructible. He's still a planeswalker. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to him this turn.
[−15]: Exile all other permanents.

cards.name: Hunted Lammasu
cards.text:
Flying
When Hunted Lammasu enters the battlefield, target opponent creates a 4/4 black Horror creature token.
cards.flavor: The lammasu ruled the velds before the city grew. Now they roam Ravnica's skies, but their ancient enemies have not forgotten them.

cards.name: Knight of the White Orchid
cards.text:
First strike
When Knight of the White Orchid enters the battlefield, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for a Plains card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Martial Impetus
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and is goaded. (It attacks each combat if able and attacks a player other than you if able.)
Whenever enchanted creature attacks, each other creature that's attacking one of your opponents gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Oblation
cards.text: The owner of target nonland permanent shuffles it into their library, then draws two cards.
cards.flavor: "A richer people could give more but they could never give as much."

cards.name: Oreskos Explorer
cards.text: When Oreskos Explorer enters the battlefield, search your library for up to X Plains cards, where X is the number of players who control more lands than you. Reveal those cards, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Orzhov Advokist
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, each player may put two +1/+1 counters on a creature they control. If a player does, creatures that player controls can't attack you or a planeswalker you control until your next turn.
cards.flavor: The Orzhov care not for repentance, only repayment.

cards.name: Return to Dust
cards.text: Exile target artifact or enchantment. If you cast this spell during your main phase, you may exile up to one other target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: Some timelines forever fray, branch, and intermingle. Others end abruptly.

cards.name: Rout
cards.text:
You may cast Rout as though it had flash if you pay {2} more to cast it. (You may cast it any time you could cast an instant.)
Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"End this. What I seek is far greater."
-Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

cards.name: Sanctum Gargoyle
cards.text:
